shortdesc.ph: Sets whether to enable the automatic cache file removal feature.
Sets whether to enable automatic removal of cache files.
Enables or disables the automatic cache file removal feature.
Enables or disables automatic cache file removal.

section.p: When automatic cache file removal is enabled, if the number or size of cached media files in the player exceeds the set limit, the SDK automatically removes the least recently used cached file.

After enabling automatic removal of cache files, when the number or total size of cached media files in the player exceeds the set limit, the SDK will automatically remove the least recently used cache file.
When automatic cache file removal is enabled, if the number or total size of cached media files in the player exceeds the set limit, the SDK automatically removes the least recently used cache file.
When automatic cache file removal is enabled, if the number of cached media files or the total cache size exceeds the limit you set, the SDK automatically deletes the least recently used cache file.

plentry.pd:
Whether to automatically remove cached files:
: Enable automatic cache file removal.
: (Default) Disable automatic cache file removal.

Whether to automatically remove cache files:
: Enable automatic removal of cache files.
: (Default) Disable automatic removal of cache files.

Whether to enable automatic cache file removal:
: Enables automatic cache file removal.
: (Default) Disables automatic cache file removal.

Whether to enable automatic cache file removal:
: Enable automatic cache file removal.
: (default) Disable automatic cache file removal.

section.title: Return Values
section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See .
